original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (1)🔽19.10. Ācayagāmittika🔽Naācayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca apacayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  ācaya gāmittika  na ācaya gāmim dhammam paṭicca apacaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The Dhamma Section in Numerical Order (Third Set of Triads)🔽The triad on increase🔽With an increase in states unaccompanied by gladness as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by gladness. (In brief:)🔽With an increase in states unaccompanied by gladness as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by grief.

original: Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: With an increase in states unaccompanied by gladness as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by equanimity.🔽With an increase in states unaccompanied by grief as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by grief.🔽With an increase in states unaccompanied by grief as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by gladness.🔽With an increase in states unaccompanied by grief as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by equanimity.🔽With an increase in states unaccompanied by equanimity as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by equanimity.🔽With an increase in states unaccompanied by equanimity as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by gladness.🔽With an increase in states unaccompanied by equanimity as condition there is an increase in states unaccompanied by grief.
